pages.text: Create is one of the most in-depth mods out there, so you might find yourself reading this for a long time. $(br2)It is also essential in this modpack. $(br2)An important thing to remmeber is Press W to Ponder.

This material is the foundation of Create, make a lot of it. $(br2)I recommend using the version of the recipe that only needs 2 Iron Ingots and 2 Andesite Alloy blocks. $(br2)Turn to the next page to see the recipe.
This recipe can't be mirrored.$(br2)In base Create, Zinc Ore is a non-renewable resource. Consequently, this makes Brass non-renewable.

Knowing this, it is only logical to use Iron Nuggets instead of Zinc Nuggets when making Andesite Alloy.$(br2)Iron is renewable while Zinc is not.$(br2)Also, a fun fact: Copper is actually renewable from Drowned in vanilla Minecraft.

Copper in Create is important for everything liquid related.$(br2)It is also used to make Brass and is essential to make Fluid Tanks for use in steam boilers, the most powerful source of stress units.
Raw zinc ore can only be mined with an Iron or higher tier pickaxe.$(br2)Its primary purpose is to make Brass and Rose Quartz Lamps. It is also normally not renewable in base Create.

It takes one Zinc Ingot and one Copper Ingot in a Blaze Burner heated Basin with a Mechanical Mixer directly on top of the Basin.$(br2)As for what Brass is used for, it is used in many recipes in the Brass Age.
This is the first step to making an Electron Tube. However, Rose Quartz has to be polished through the use of Sandpaper.
Electron Tubes are another important ingredient that goes in hand with contraptions and machines from the Brass Age.$(br2)They make them intelligent, smarter and better.
The first step in making Sturdy Sheets. It is made by crushing Obsidian blocks with a pair of Crushing Wheels.
Primarily used for making Create Logistics train related things.$(br2)The recipe involves a Spout pouring lava on the first step, then two Mechanical Presses to forge the Sturdy Sheets.
